CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 30, 1962, pg. 3, reads: "Girl's Handbag Was In Can - County Detective James Cotter (left) and Sam Zaugg, Munhall chief of police, peered into a charred garbage pail in back yard of murder suspect Clarence Mitchell's home. The charred handbag of Mavis Todd, the murdered girl, was deposited in the pail, last week, in the hope that the garbage collector would destroy the evidence.  The garbage service was delayed, however, to put added pressure on the accused man. - Harris Photo."  Portion of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1962, pg. 1, reads: "W. Mifflin Man Admits Slaying - Cement Worker Bludgeons Nurse; Hides Her Body - Clarence Mitchell, 28, of 3715 Homestead Ave., West Mifflin, confessed to the brutal slaying of Mavis Todd, 20, nurses aide of West Mifflin..."
TitMainTitle: Allegheny County Detective James Cotter and Munhall Police Chief Sam Zuagg looking into pail in yard of Mitchell home, West Mifflin
